 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;65.1&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;82.8&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Net income&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;6.3&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;29.6&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;28.3&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;28.0&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;


 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=8% align=left&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&amp;#xA0;8.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;&lt;b&gt;Derivative Financial
 Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company uses interest rate swaps
 commodity swaps
 futures
 option and swaption (an option on a swap) contracts
 as well as
 forward foreign currency contracts
 to hedge market risks relating
 to possible adverse changes in interest rates
 commodity
 transportation
 foreign currency exchange rates and other input
 price exposures. The Company continually monitors its positions and
 the credit ratings of the counterparties involved to mitigate the
 amount of credit exposure to any one party.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company designates each derivative contract as one of the
 following: (1)&amp;#xA0;a hedge of a forecasted transaction or of the
 variability of cash flows to be received or paid related to a
 recognized asset or liability (&amp;#x201C;cash flow hedge&amp;#x201D;) or
 (2)&amp;#xA0;a hedging instrument whose change in fair value is
 recognized to act as an economic hedge but does not meet the
 requirements to receive hedge accounting treatment (&amp;#x201C;economic
 hedge&amp;#x201D;). As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the Company had both cash
 flow and economic hedges.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Interest Rates:&lt;/b&gt; The Company&amp;#x2019;s debt primarily consists
 of floating rate term loans and fixed rate notes. The Company
 historically maintained its floating rate revolver for flexibility
 to fund seasonal working capital needs and for other uses of cash.
 Following the sale of the Consumer Products Business during fiscal
 2014
 the Company no longer expects to have material changes in
 working capital due to seasonality. Interest expense on the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s floating rate debt is typically calculated based on
 a fixed spread over a reference rate
 such as LIBOR (also known as
 the Eurodollar rate). Therefore
 fluctuations in market interest
 rates will cause interest expense increases or decreases on a given
 amount of floating rate debt.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Swaps are recorded as an asset or liability in the Consolidated
 Balance Sheets at fair value. The Company currently accounts for
 these interest rate swaps as economic hedges and any gains and
 losses are recorded in other (income) expense
 net.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company from time to time manages a portion of its interest
 rate risk related to floating rate debt by entering into interest
 rate swaps in which the Company receives floating rate payments and
 makes fixed rate payments. As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the following
 economic hedge swaps were outstanding:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=80% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=91%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=1%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=1%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=1%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=1%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;Contract date&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom colspan=2 align=center&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Notional&amp;#xA0;amount&lt;br /&gt;
 (in millions)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom colspan=2 align=center&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Fixed&amp;#xA0;LIBOR&amp;#xA0;rate&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;Effective&amp;#xA0;date&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;Maturity&amp;#xA0;date&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 1px&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom colspan=13&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 April&amp;#xA0;12
 2011&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;900.0&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;3.029%&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;September&amp;#xA0;4
&amp;#xA0;2012&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;
 September&amp;#xA0;1
&amp;#xA0;2015&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 On August&amp;#xA0;13
 2010
 the Company entered into interest rate
 swaps with a total notional amount of $300.0 million as the fixed
 rate payer and an effective date of February&amp;#xA0;1
 2011. The
 interest rate swaps fixed LIBOR at 1.368% for the term of the swaps
 and expired during fiscal 2014 on February&amp;#xA0;3
 2014.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 1px; MARGIN-TOP: 16px&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 The fair values of the Company&amp;#x2019;s interest rate swaps were
 recorded as current liabilities of $25.4 million and non-current
 liabilities of $9.8 million at April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014. The fair values
 of the Company&amp;#x2019;s interest rate swaps were recorded as current
 liabilities of $28.4 million and non-current liabilities of $33.5
 million at April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Commodities:&lt;/b&gt; Certain commodities such as soybean meal
 corn
 wheat
 soybean oil
 diesel fuel and natural gas (collectively
 &amp;#x201C;commodity contracts&amp;#x201D;) are used in the production and
 transportation of the Company&amp;#x2019;s products. Generally these
 commodities are purchased based upon market prices that are
 established with the vendor as part of the purchase process. The
 Company uses futures
 swaps
 and swaption or option contracts
 as
 deemed appropriate; to reduce the effect of price fluctuations on
 anticipated purchases. These contracts may have a term of up to 24
 months. The Company accounts for these commodities derivatives as
 either economic or cash flow hedges. Changes in the value of
 economic hedges are recorded directly in earnings. For cash flow
 hedges
 the effective portion of derivative gains and losses is
 deferred in equity and recognized as part of cost of products sold
 in the appropriate period and the ineffective portion is recognized
 as other (income) expense
 net.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The fair values of the Company&amp;#x2019;s commodities hedges were
 recorded as current assets of $9.4 million as of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014. The fair values of the Company&amp;#x2019;s commodities hedges
 were recorded as current assets of $3.0 million and current
 liabilities of $9.7 million at April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013. The notional
 amounts of the Company&amp;#x2019;s commodity contracts as of the dates
 indicated (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;

 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Commodity contracts&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;213.4&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Foreign Currency:&lt;/b&gt; From time to time
 the Company manages its
 exposure to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates by
 entering into forward contracts to cover a portion of its projected
 expenditures paid in local currency. These contracts may have a
 term of up to 24 months. The Company accounted for these contracts
 as either economic hedges or cash flow hedges. Changes in the value
 of the economic hedges are recorded directly in earnings. For cash
 flow hedges
 the effective portion of derivative gains and losses
 is deferred in equity and recognized as part of cost of products
 sold in the appropriate period and the ineffective portion is
 recognized as other (income) expense
 net. Changes in the value of
 the economic hedges are recorded directly in earnings. The Company
 did not have any outstanding foreign currency hedges as of
 April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 because the Company did not believe it was in
 its best interest at the time. The Company did not have any
 outstanding foreign currency hedges in continuing operations as of
 April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013. The Company may again in the future enter into
 foreign currency forward contracts.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Derivative Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The fair value of derivative instruments recorded in the
 Consolidated Balance Sheets as of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 was as
 follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 18pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;Asset&amp;#xA0;derivatives&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td style=BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid valign=bottom colspan=6 align=center&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;Liability&amp;#xA0;derivatives&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;

 &lt;td valign=top width=17% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;Includes $7.6 million of commodity
 contracts (asset derivatives) designated as cash flow hedges.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 1px; MARGIN-TOP: 16px&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;

 Consolidated Balance Sheets as of April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013 was as
 follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt align=center&gt;&lt;b&gt;hedging relationships&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

 (liability derivatives) designated as cash flow hedges.&lt;/td&gt;

 expense

 periods indicated below was as follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 The Company did not have cash flow hedges during fiscal 2012.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 At April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 $6.5 million is expected to be reclassified
 from AOCI to cost of products sold within the next 12 months.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=margin-top:14pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Retirement Benefits:&lt;/b&gt; The Company sponsors a qualified
 defined benefit pension plan and several unfunded defined benefit
 postretirement plans
 providing certain medical
 dental and life
 insurance and other benefits to eligible retired
 salaried
 non-union hourly and union employees. Under the direction of the
 Company
 third-party actuaries utilize statistical and other
 factors to anticipate future events in calculating an estimate of
 the expense and liabilities related to these plans. The actuarial
 reports are used by the Company in estimating the expenses and
 liabilities related to these plans. The factors utilized by the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s actuaries include assumptions about the discount
 rate
 expected return on plan assets
 the health care cost trend
 rate
 withdrawal and mortality rates and the rate of increase in
 compensation levels. These assumptions may differ materially from
 actual results due to changing market and economic conditions
 higher or lower withdrawal rates or longer or shorter mortality of
 participants. These differences may impact the amount of retirement
 benefit expense recorded by the Company in future periods. The
 funded status of the Company&amp;#x2019;s pension and other
 postretirement plans is recorded as an asset or a liability and all
 unrecognized gains or losses
 net of tax
 are recorded as a
 component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss)
 (&amp;#x201C;AOCI&amp;#x201D;) within stockholder&amp;#x2019;s equity.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The provision (benefit) for income taxes from continuing operations
 consists of the following (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Note 4. Discontinued Operations&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;!-- xbrl
body --&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Net sales from discontinued operations for fiscal 2014 (through the
 sale date)
 fiscal 2013
 and fiscal 2012 were $1
330.7 million
 $1
830.4 million
 and $1
815.4 million
 respectively. Income (loss)
 from discontinued operations before income taxes for fiscal 2014
 fiscal 2013
 and fiscal 2012 was $(75.1) million
 $152.7 million
 and $154.0 million
 respectively. Depreciation and amortization
 expense from discontinued operations for fiscal 2014
 fiscal 2013
 and fiscal 2012 was $22.2 million
 $43.9 million and $42.5 million
 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;

 group sold on February&amp;#xA0;18
 2014 included the following (in
 millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the Company had recorded a gross
 receivable of $16.3 million for the working capital adjustment
 in
 accordance with the Purchase Agreement. Subsequent to fiscal year
 end
 the Company received a Notice of Disagreement from the
 Acquiror disputing the working capital adjustment presented by the
 Company.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;

 held for sale as of the date indicated are reflected at fair value
 less costs to sell and include the following (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 2em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Total discontinued operations-liabilities&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;346.4&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: rgb(0,0,0) 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: rgb(0,0,0) 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;!-- End Table Body --&gt;&lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 Income (loss) from discontinued operations during the fiscal year
 ended April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 reflects a non-cash impairment charge of
 $193.8 million before income taxes
 recognized in the second
 quarter of fiscal 2014
 in the Consolidated Statements of
 Operations. The impairment was allocated between net property
 plant and equipment and net intangible assets based on the relative
 book value. Income (loss) from discontinued operations before
 income taxes during the fiscal year ended April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 reflects a gain recognized on sale of the Consumer Products
 Business of $1.2 million
 exclusive of the non-cash impairment
 charge discussed above.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Deferred tax assets and liabilities
 which result in future taxable
 or deductible amounts for the assets and liabilities related to the
 Consumer Products Business&amp;#x2019; domestic operations
 were not
 allocated to discontinued operations in accordance with GAAP.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Under the Purchase Agreement
 and as defined therein
 the Acquiror
 assumed all known or potential future legal liabilities related to
 the Consumer Products Business at the closing date of
 February&amp;#xA0;18
 2014.&lt;/p&gt;

  

 &lt;p style=margin-top:16pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Income Taxes:&lt;/b&gt; The Company accounts for income taxes under
 the asset and liability method. Deferred tax assets and liabilities
 are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to
 differences between the financial statement book values of existing
 assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases
 and for tax
 losses and tax credit carryforwards. Deferred tax assets and
 liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply
 to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences
 are expected to be recovered or settled. The effect on deferred tax
 assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in
 earnings in the period that includes the enactment date. In
 assessing the realizability of deferred tax assets
 management
 considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or
 all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. An uncertain
 tax position is recognized if it is determined that it is more
 likely than not to be sustained upon examination. The tax position
 is measured as the largest amount of benefit that is greater than
 fifty percent likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement.
 The Company files a consolidated return with Parent.&amp;#xA0;The
 Company allocates current and deferred taxes to each member as if
 it were a separate taxpayer.&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Advertising Expense:&lt;/b&gt; Costs associated with advertising are
 generally expensed as incurred and included in selling
 general and
 administrative expense. Marketing expense
 which includes
 advertising expense
 was as follows for the periods indicated (in
 millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;b&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;Fiscal&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;br /&gt;

 benefits and other benefits for the periods indicated
 including
 discontinued operations

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt; WIDTH: 10%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 3%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;Including
 discontinued operations.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The following table presents financial information about the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s operating segment (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=99% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;

 interest
 expense has not been allocated to discontinued operations.&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt; WIDTH: 13%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=2% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;The Pension Protection Act of 2006
 ranks the funded status of multiemployer pension plans depending
 upon a plan&amp;#x2019;s current and projected funding. A plan is in the
 Red Zone (Critical) if it has a current funded percentage less than
 65%. A plan is in the Yellow Zone (Endangered) if it has a current
 funded percentage of less than 80%
 or projects a credit balance
 deficit within seven years. A plan is in the Green Zone (Healthy)
 if it has a current funded percentage greater than 80% and does not
 have a projected credit balance deficit within seven years. The
 zone status is based on the plan&amp;#x2019;s year end
 not the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s year-end. The zone status is based on information
 that the Company received from the plan and is certified by the
 plan&amp;#x2019;s actuary. During calendar year 2013
 the Bakery and
 Confectionery Union and Industry International Health Benefits and
 Pension Fund (Bakery and Confectionery Union Fund) was in Red Zone
 status. Although the current funding status as of calendar year
 2013 was 66.41%
 the Company&amp;#x2019;s actuary concluded that the
 funding status is more than likely to fall below 65% within the
 next five years and has classified the Bakery and Confectionery
 Union Fund in Red Zone status.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=2% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;Funding Improvement Plan or
 Rehabilitation Plan as defined under ERISA has been implemented or
 is pending.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=2% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;3&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;Whether the Company paid a surcharge
 to the Plan in the most current year due to funding shortfalls and
 the amount of the surcharge.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=2% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;4&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;The Company was not listed in the
 Plan&amp;#x2019;s Form 5500 as providing more than 5% of the total
 contributions for the plan year ending December&amp;#xA0;31
 2012
 the
 most recent year available.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Principles of Consolidation:&lt;/b&gt; The consolidated financial
 statements include the accounts of the Company and its
 subsidiaries. All intercompany accounts and transactions have been
 eliminated upon consolidation. The Company accounts for its
 investments in joint ventures under the equity method of
 accounting
 under which the investment in the joint venture is
 adjusted for the Company&amp;#x2019;s share of the undistributed profit
 or loss of the joint venture.&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt&gt;
 As described in Note 4
 the Company recognized a non-cash
 impairment charge of $193.8 million before income taxes in the
 second quarter of fiscal 2014 as well as a pre-tax gain on sale of
 $1.2 million (recognized in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2014)
 related to the sale of the Consumer Products Business. In the
 fourth quarter of fiscal 2014
 the Company also incurred a
 significant tax expense within discontinued operations associated
 with the significant taxable gain on the sale of the Consumer
 Products Business.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt&gt;
 Net sales and operating income as presented in the quarterly
 results of operations above are for continuing operations.&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the following economic hedge swaps were
 outstanding:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=80% align=center border=0&gt;

 April&amp;#xA0;12
 2011&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;900.0&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;3.029%&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;September&amp;#xA0;4
&amp;#xA0;2012&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;
 September&amp;#xA0;1
&amp;#xA0;2015&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Goodwill and Intangibles with Indefinite Lives:&lt;/b&gt; The Company
 does not amortize goodwill and intangible assets with indefinite
 lives
 but instead tests for impairment at least annually.
 Additional impairment tests may be performed between annual tests
 if circumstances indicate that a potential impairment exists. The
 Company has designated the first day of the fourth fiscal quarter
 as the annual impairment testing date
 at which time the Company
 engages third-party valuation experts to assist in the valuation of
 its intangible assets with indefinite lives and reporting units
 that have goodwill assigned to them.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 When conducting the annual impairment test for goodwill
 the
 Company compares the estimated fair value of a reporting unit
 containing goodwill to its book value. The estimated fair value is
 computed using two approaches: the income approach
 which is the
 present value of expected cash flows
 discounted at a risk-adjusted
 weighted-average cost of capital; and the market approach
 which is
 based on using market multiples of companies in similar lines of
 business. If the fair value of the reporting unit is determined to
 be more than its book value
 no goodwill impairment is
 recognized.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 If the fair value of the reporting unit is determined to be less
 than its book value
 actual goodwill impairment
 if any
 is
 computed using a second step of the impairment test. The second
 step requires the fair value of the reporting unit to be allocated
 to all the assets and liabilities of the reporting unit as if the
 reporting unit had been acquired in a business combination at the
 date of the impairment test. The excess of the fair value of the
 reporting unit over the fair value of assets less liabilities is
 the implied value of goodwill and is used to determine the amount
 of impairment.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 For intangible assets with indefinite lives
 estimated fair value
 is determined using the relief from royalty method
 which is based
 upon the estimated rent or royalty the Company would pay for the
 use of a brand name if the Company did not own it and discounted at
 a risk-adjusted weighted-average cost of capital.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 In estimating discounted future cash flows
 management uses
 historical financial information
 as well as the Company&amp;#x2019;s
 operating plans and projections
 which include assumptions
 regarding sales trends and profitability
 as well as macroeconomic
 factors. Considerable judgment is necessary in estimating future
 cash flows
 market interest rates
 discount rates
 and other
 factors used in the income approach
 market approach or relief from
 royalty method used to value goodwill and intangible assets with
 indefinite lives. Different assumptions regarding future
 performance
 discount rates or other factors could result in future
 impairment losses.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;

 &lt;p style=margin-top:14pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Asset Retirement Obligations:&lt;/b&gt; Asset retirement obligations
 generally apply to legal obligations associated with the retirement
 of tangible long-lived assets that result from the acquisition
 construction or development and the normal operation of a
 long-lived asset. The Company assesses asset retirement obligations
 on a periodic basis. If a reasonable estimate of fair value can be
 made
 the fair value of a liability for an asset retirement
 obligation is recognized in the period in which it is incurred or a
 change in estimate occurs. Associated asset retirement costs are
 capitalized as part of the book value of the long-lived asset. Over
 time the liability increases reflecting the accretion of the
 obligation from its present value to the amount the Company will
 pay to extinguish the liability and the capitalized asset
 retirement costs are depreciated over the useful lives of the
 related assets. As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 and April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013
 the asset retirement obligation totaled $4.6 million and $4.3
 million
 respectively. In addition
 certain of the Company&amp;#x2019;s
 production facilities may contain asbestos that would have to be
 removed if such facilities were to be demolished or undergo a major
 renovation. The Company cannot reasonably estimate the fair value
 of the liability for asbestos removal at its production facilities
 and because the timing of the settlement of any such liability is
 not currently determinable
 has not recorded an asset retirement
 obligation for these matters.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Inventories:&lt;/b&gt; The cost of finished products inventories
 includes raw materials
 direct labor
 certain freight and
 warehousing costs and indirect production and overhead costs.
 Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market. The Company
 uses the first-in
 first-out (&amp;#x201C;FIFO&amp;#x201D;) method to value
 its inventories.&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt; WIDTH: 10%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;These
 accumulated and other comprehensive income (loss) components are
 included in the computation of net periodic benefit costs. See Note
 11 for additional information.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Property
 Plant and Equipment and Depreciation:&lt;/b&gt; Property
 plant and equipment are stated at cost and are depreciated over
 their estimated useful lives
 using the straight-line method.
 Maintenance and repairs are expensed as incurred. Significant
 expenditures that increase useful lives are capitalized. The
 principal estimated useful lives generally are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 14pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=50% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=80%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=8%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td style=BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid valign=bottom align=center&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;Useful&amp;#xA0;lives&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Land improvements&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;5-40&amp;#xA0;years&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Building and leasehold improvements&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=center&gt;10-50&amp;#xA0;years&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 The Company&amp;#x2019;s capitalization of software development costs
 for internal use begins in the application development stage and
 ends when the asset is placed into service. The Company amortizes
 such costs using the straight-line method over estimated useful
 lives. Including costs paid to third-party vendors
 the Company
 capitalized the following related to systems supporting the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s infrastructure (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt&gt;
 The Company had certain assets classified as held for sale for
 continuing operations with a net book value of $9.5 million as of
 April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014. The Company did not have any assets classified
 as held for sale for continuing operations as of April&amp;#xA0;28
 2013.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=margin-top:16pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Cash Equivalents:&lt;/b&gt; The Company considers all highly liquid
 investments with an original maturity date of three months or less
 to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Note 5. Natural Balance Acquisition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 On July&amp;#xA0;15
 2013
 DMC completed the acquisition of Natural
 Balance
 a California corporation and maker of premium pet products
 for dogs and cats sold throughout North America. The total cost of
 the Natural Balance acquisition as of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 was
 $331.4 million and included an initial $341.1 million cash payment
 (including $26.2 million paid into an escrow account) and
 contingent consideration of $0.3 million
 reduced by an estimated
 working capital adjustment and cash received from escrow. The total
 cost of the acquisition is subject to a post-closing working
 capital adjustment which was initially due from the Company 90 days
 after closing (see discussion below). Final agreement of the
 working capital adjustment has not yet occurred.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The acquisition was accounted for under the acquisition method. The
 purchase price was allocated to the identifiable assets and
 liabilities
 including brand names
 based on estimated fair value
 with the remaining purchase price recorded as goodwill. The Company
 utilized an independent valuation firm to assist in estimating the
 fair value of Natural Balance&amp;#x2019;s real estate
 machinery and
 equipment
 and identifiable intangible assets.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the Company had recorded an adjustment
 to certain working capital accounts as of the acquisition date and
 a corresponding receivable for the working capital adjustment
 as
 referred to above. The Company&amp;#x2019;s allocation of the purchase
 price to the net tangible and intangible assets acquired and
 liabilities assumed
 including the working capital adjustments
 referred to above
 is as follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=60% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=87%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=4%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=4%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td style=BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid valign=bottom colspan=2 align=center&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;July&amp;#xA0;15
&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 $&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Net assets acquired&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;331.4&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 1px&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 The acquisition of Natural Balance includes a contingent
 consideration arrangement that requires additional cash to be paid
 by the Company based on the future net sales of Natural Balance
 over a one year period. The range of the undiscounted amounts the
 Company could pay under the contingent consideration agreement is
 $0.0&amp;#xA0;million to $17.5 million
 and is based on net sales
 measured for the 12 month period ending May&amp;#xA0;1
 2016 with
 payment due August&amp;#xA0;22
 2016. Contingent consideration
 recognized on the acquisition date was $0.3 million and was based
 on the purchase agreement. The fair value of the contingent
 consideration on the acquisition date was estimated by applying the
 income approach. As of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014
 the Company recorded a
 fair value adjustment to contingent consideration of $2.8 million
 which is included in selling
 general and administrative expense in
 fiscal 2014. The Company has classified the contingent
 consideration as Level 3 of the fair value hierarchy as it is based
 on unobservable inputs. Significant inputs and assumptions are
 management&amp;#x2019;s estimate of net sales using probability weighted
 estimates and the discount rate used to calculate the present value
 of the liability. Significant changes in any Level 3 input or
 assumption would result in increases or decreases to fair value
 measurements for contingent consideration. See Note 9 for a
 discussion regarding the fair value hierarchy and the definition of
 Levels 1
 2 and 3.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Goodwill is not deductible for tax purposes. The Company executed
 the acquisition of Natural Balance with the objective of
 complementing the Company&amp;#x2019;s substantial pet products
 portfolio and expanding sales in the high growth pet specialty
 channel.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The acquired business contributed net sales of $211.7 million from
 the acquisition date to April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014. The following
 unaudited pro forma financial information presents the combined
 results of operations of the Company
 including Natural Balance
 as
 if the acquisition had occurred as of the beginning of the periods
 presented. The unaudited pro forma financial information is not
 intended to represent or be indicative of the Company&amp;#x2019;s
 consolidated financial results of operations that would have been
 reported had the business combination been completed as of the
 beginning of the periods presented and should not be taken as
 indicative of the Company&amp;#x2019;s future consolidated results of
 operations (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=90% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=76%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=3%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=3%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=3%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom width=3%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td style=BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid valign=bottom colspan=2 align=center&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;Fiscal&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;br /&gt;
 2014&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=8% align=left&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note&amp;#xA0;12.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;&lt;b&gt;Accumulated Other Comprehensive
 Income (Loss)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt&gt;
 The following table summarizes the reclassifications from
 accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) to the Consolidated
 Statements of Operations for the fiscal year ended April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 Total reclassifications&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;(1.8)&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;Net of tax&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 1px&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt; WIDTH: 10%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;These
 accumulated and other comprehensive income (loss) components are
 included in the computation of net periodic benefit costs. See Note
 11 for additional information.&lt;/p&gt;

  

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 14pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Cost of Products Sold:&lt;/b&gt; Cost of products sold represents
 expenses incurred that are directly connected with bringing the
 products to a salable condition. These costs include raw materials
 packaging
 labor
 certain transportation and warehousing costs
 as
 well as overhead expenses.&lt;/p&gt;


 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The unaudited pro forma financial information is not intended to
 represent or be indicative of the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated
 financial results of operations that would have been reported had
 the business combination been completed as of the beginning of the
 periods presented and should not be taken as indicative of the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s future consolidated results of operations (in
 millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Defined Benefit Plans.&lt;/b&gt; The Company sponsors a qualified
 defined benefit pension plan (&amp;#x201C;pension benefits&amp;#x201D; or
 &amp;#x201C;pension plan&amp;#x201D;) and several unfunded defined benefit
 postretirement plans (&amp;#x201C;other benefits&amp;#x201D; or
 &amp;#x201C;postretirement plans&amp;#x201D;) providing certain medical
 dental and life insurance benefits to eligible retired
 salaried
 non-union hourly and union employees. The details of such plans
 including discontinued operations
 are as follows (in
 millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 2pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt; WIDTH: 7%&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=100% border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=3%&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top width=2% align=left&gt;&lt;sup style=FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top&gt;1&lt;/sup&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top align=left&gt;The plans assets transferred to the
 Acquiror are an estimate which could differ from actual results.
 Please refer to discussion below regarding requirements under the
 Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;

 benefits and other benefits for the periods indicated
 including
 discontinued operations

 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap align=right&gt;-&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 3em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Net periodic benefit cost (credit)&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;(26.7)&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;9.1&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;9.9&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 1px&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 For fiscal 2015
 pension benefits expense for continuing operations
 is expected to be approximately $3.9 million. Other benefits
 expense for fiscal 2015 is currently estimated to be approximately
 a net credit of $0.1 million as the net amortization gain exceeds
 service and interest costs. These estimates incorporate the
 Company&amp;#x2019;s fiscal 2015 assumptions. Actual future pension
 benefit and other benefit expense amounts may vary depending upon
 the accuracy of original assumptions and future assumptions.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;i&gt;Sale of the Consumer Products Business&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Following the sale of the Consumer Products Business
 the Company
 transferred a significant amount of the plan obligations and plan
 assets for the pension benefits and other benefits
 as well as the
 related components of net periodic benefit costs
 for the
 transferred employees and retirees of the Consumer Products
 Business to the Acquiror. Plan assets for pension benefits must be
 allocated to the Acquiror in accordance with the Employee
 Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (&amp;#x201C;ERISA&amp;#x201D;)
 Section&amp;#xA0;4044
 which the Company expects to be completed in
 fiscal 2015. The plan assets presented are an estimate which could
 differ from actual results.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;i&gt;Assumptions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Since the pension plan and other benefits liabilities are measured
 on a discounted basis
 the discount rate is a significant
 assumption. The discount rate was determined based on an analysis
 of interest rates for high-quality
 long-term corporate debt at
 each measurement date. In order to appropriately match the bond
 maturities with expected future cash payments
 the Company utilizes
 differing bond portfolios to estimate the discount rates for the
 pension plan and for the other benefits. The discount rate used to
 determine the pension plan and other benefits projected benefit
 obligation as of the balance sheet date is the rate in effect at
 the measurement date. The same rate is also used to determine the
 pension plan and other benefits expense for the following fiscal
 year. The long-term rate of return for the pension plan&amp;#x2019;s
 assets is based on the Company&amp;#x2019;s historical experience
 the
 pension plan&amp;#x2019;s investment guidelines and the Company&amp;#x2019;s
 expectations for long-term rates of return. The pension
 plan&amp;#x2019;s investment guidelines are established based upon an
 evaluation of market conditions
 tolerance for risk and cash
 requirements for benefit payments.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The following table presents the weighted-average assumptions used
 to determine the projected benefit obligations for pension benefits
 and other benefits:&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;i&gt;Sensitivity of Assumptions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 For measurement purposes
 an annual rate of increase in the per
 capita cost of covered health care benefits was assumed as
 indicated below:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;table style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=98% align=center border=0&gt;
 &lt;tr&gt;
 &lt;td width=93%&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The rate of increase is assumed to decline gradually to 4.0% for
 the preferred provider organization and associated indemnity plans
 as well as for the health maintenance organization plans.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The health care cost trend rate assumption has a significant effect
 on the amounts reported. The following table presents the impact of
 a 1% increase or decrease of the health care cost trend rate on the
 projected benefit obligation and the aggregate of the service and
 interest cost components of net periodic benefit cost of other
 benefits
 for continuing operations
 as of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 and
 for the year then ended
 respectively (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 No amounts will be amortized from AOCI into net periodic benefit
 cost over the next fiscal year for the pension plan. Amortization
 of net gain of $1.7 million will be recognized for other benefit
 plans.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 1px; MARGIN-TOP: 18px&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &lt;i&gt;Contributions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company made contributions to the pension plan of $10.0 million
 for fiscal 2014. The Company currently meets and plans to continue
 to meet the minimum funding levels required under the Pension
 Protection Act of 2006 (the &amp;#x201C;Act&amp;#x201D;). The Act imposes
 certain consequences on the Company&amp;#x2019;s pension plan if it does
 not meet the minimum funding levels. The Company has made
 contributions in excess of its required minimum amounts for fiscal
 2014
 fiscal 2013
 and fiscal 2012 and is more than 100% funded as
 of April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014. Due to uncertainties of future funding
 levels
 as well as plan financial returns
 the Company cannot
 predict whether it will continue to achieve specified plan funding
 thresholds or remain fully funded. The Company currently expects to
 make a contribution of approximately $8 million in fiscal 2015.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;

 2014 the projected future benefit payments for

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;1.5&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman bgcolor=#CCEEFF&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 2019&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;11.4&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;1.6&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;tr style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&gt;
 &lt;td valign=top&gt;
 &lt;p style=FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 1em; TEXT-INDENT: -1em&gt;
 Years 2020-2024&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;61.9&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;font style=FONT-SIZE: 8pt&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;9.4&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;i&gt;Fair Value Hierarchy of Plan Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Plan assets:&lt;/b&gt; The Company has adopted the fair value
 provisions (as described in Note 9) for the plan assets of its
 pension plan. The Company categorizes plan assets within a three
 level fair value hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The following is a description of the valuation methodologies used
 for assets measured at fair value:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Investments stated at fair value as determined by quoted market
 prices (Level 1) include:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Interest bearing cash:&lt;/b&gt; valued based on cost
 which
 approximates fair value;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Mutual funds:&lt;/b&gt; valued at quoted market prices on the last
 business day of the fiscal year;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Corporate stock:&lt;/b&gt; valued at the last reported sales price on
 the last business day of the fiscal year; and&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Government securities:&lt;/b&gt; securities traded on a national
 securities exchange are valued at the last reported sales price on
 the last business day of the fiscal year.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Investments stated at estimated fair value using significant
 observable inputs (Level 2) include:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Common collective trust funds:&lt;/b&gt; valued based on the net asset
 value of the fund and is redeemable daily;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Corporate debt securities:&lt;/b&gt; valued based on yields currently
 available on comparable securities of issuers with similar credit
 ratings;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Government securities:&lt;/b&gt; securities traded in the
 over-the-counter market and listed securities for which no sale was
 reported on the last business day of the fiscal year are valued at
 the average of the last reported bid and ask price; and&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 1px; MARGIN-TOP: 12px&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 Investments stated at estimated fair value using significant
 unobservable inputs (Level 3) include:&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 5%; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Limited partnership interests:&lt;/b&gt; valued at their estimated
 fair value based on audited financial statements of the
 partnerships.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The following table sets forth by level within the fair value
 hierarchy of the plan&amp;#x2019;s assets at fair value as of
 April&amp;#xA0;27
 2014 (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 16pt; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt&gt;
 &amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;

 Fixed income&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap align=right&gt;-&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 In accordance with the Purchase Agreement
 an initial transfer
 representing a portion of the fair value of plan assets related to
 the Consumer Products Business was completed in connection with the
 closing date of February&amp;#xA0;18
 2014. A true-up adjustment is due
 within 270 days after the transaction closing date. The total fair
 value of the plan&amp;#x2019;s assets in the table above includes the
 estimated residual fair value of plan assets to be transferred
 and
 is reconciled to plan assets reflected in the Consolidated Balance
 Sheets as follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 There were no transfers of plan assets between Level 1 and Level 2
 or into or out of Level 3 during fiscal 2014 and fiscal 2013.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company held investments in a private limited partnership with
 unobservable inputs (Level 3). Investments are valued at estimated
 fair value based on audited financial statements received from the
 general partner. The general partner annually engages an
 independent appraiser to value the investments of the limited
 partnership.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 Changes in fair value measurements of Level 3 investments during
 fiscal 2014 were as follows (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom align=right&gt;4.3&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;#xA0;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;

 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;

 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td valign=bottom&gt;
 &lt;p style=BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;td&gt;&amp;#xA0;&lt;/td&gt;
 &lt;/tr&gt;
 &lt;/table&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 The Company&amp;#x2019;s investment objectives are to ensure that the
 assets of its pension plan are invested to provide an optimal rate
 of investment return on the total investment portfolio
 consistent
 with the assumption of a reasonable risk level
 and to ensure that
 pension funds are available to meet the plan&amp;#x2019;s benefit
 obligations as they become due. The Company believes that a
 well-diversified investment portfolio
 including both equity and
 fixed income components
 will result in the highest attainable
 investment return with an acceptable level of overall risk. The
 Company&amp;#x2019;s investment policies and procedures are designed to
 ensure that the plan&amp;#x2019;s investments are in compliance with
 ERISA.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; MARGIN-TOP: 16pt&gt;
 &lt;b&gt;Defined Contribution Plans.&lt;/b&gt; The Company participates in
 three defined contribution plans
 two of which have Company
 contributions. Company contributions to these defined contribution
 plans are based on employee contributions and compensation. Company
 contributions under these plans were as follows for the periods
 indicated (in millions):&lt;/p&gt;

 Following the sale of the Consumer Products Business
 the Company
 transferred employees and retirees under the defined contribution
 plans to the Acquiror in accordance with the Purchase
 Agreement.&lt;/p&gt;
